intro: Hedeoma camporum, commonly known as the tall goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Hedeoma camporum is often found in areas with rich, sandy soil and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
